decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining a high level of card advantage through cantrips like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble. The deck aims to utilize early creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to deal damage quickly, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Violent Urge to further enhance the aggro strategy and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively push damage through a combination of low-cost creatures and spells, using efficient removal and burn spells to control the opponent's board and finish the game quickly. The strategy revolves around dealing quick and consistent damage while maintaining card advantage with cantrips like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. Dragon's Rage Channeler provides additional card filtering and pressure, while cards like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt can prove to be versatile tools for dealing with threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to use cards like Allosaurus Rider, Neoform, and Eldritch Evolution to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Griselbrand, and Atraxa. By using efficient tutoring and ramping tools like Disciple of Freyalise and Planar Genesis, the deck aims to assemble a game-winning combo or overwhelm the opponent with creatures in a short amount of time. The inclusion of cards like Pact of Negation and Boseiju, Who Endures helps protect the combo and ensure its success. Overall, the deck is designed to achieve a fast and explosive win through strategic creature plays and combos.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Amulet of Vigor and various land bounce effects to power out Primeval Titan and combo off with Scapeshift to win the game. The deck also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key combo pieces and protect against disruption. With the ability to generate a large amount of mana and tutor for specific cards, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and win the game in a single turn.

This deck focuses on quickly generating artifacts to power out explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to generate mana and value, combined with cheap artifact creatures like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer, the deck aims to quickly establish a threatening board presence. Furthermore, cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provide disruption and protection against opposing strategies, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up artifacts and creatures on the board to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary provides additional firepower, while control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt help disrupt the opponent's game plan. Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recurring artifacts from the graveyard, making it difficult for opponents to deal with threats efficiently. The deck aims to end the game quickly before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while disrupting your opponent's game plan with taxing effects and removal spells. The goal is to pressure your opponent's life total quickly while slowing down their ability to cast spells efficiently. By utilizing cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, you can apply pressure early on, while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending help you control the board. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption, allowing you to play at instant speed and protect your creatures. The deck aims to close out games swiftly while keeping your opponent on the back foot.

The deck focuses on generating value through manipulating the board state and hand with cards like Ephemerate, Consign to Memory, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. It also utilizes powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of removal spells such as Solitude and Prismatic Ending helps control the board while maintaining aggression. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying resilient threats to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combo strategy without relying on traditional land cards. By using cards like Hydroelectric Specimen, Tameshi, Reality Architect, and Goblin Charbelcher, the deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful win condition. Counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, along with disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Sink into Stupor, help protect the combo and control the game. Card draw and tutor spells such as Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings provide consistency, while other support cards like Suppression Ray and Stern Scolding offer additional control elements.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters, Ragavan, and Phlage, supported by Ajani and Sephiroth for additional power. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Thraben Charm help clear the way for attacks, while Seasoned Pyromancer provides card advantage. Goblin Bombardment is used to deal direct damage to the opponent. The mana base includes fetchlands and shocklands to ensure consistent mana access. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, direct damage, and removal spells.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combos and synergies. It utilizes cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures, while also including graveyard recursion and card draw effects to maintain resources. The deck aims to control the board with creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Walking Ballista, while also going for aggressive plays with Malevolent Rumble and Delighted Halfling. Overall, the deck's toolbox of creatures allows for versatile and adaptable gameplay to outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while quickly overwhelming them with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to manipulate opponents' hands and board states, along with powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to control the game tempo and apply relentless pressure. Consign to Memory and Prismatic Ending provide additional removal options, while spells like Ephemerate and No More Lies offer versatility and protection. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its aggressive game plan and adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual to cast powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the board. Green creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Coiling Oracle create card advantage, while blue spells like Force of Negation and Subtlety offer protection and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and counter spells, while utilizing mana acceleration to maintain a strong board presence and control the tempo of the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a key combination of cards that allows for explosive plays and quick wins. This is achieved through cards like Devourer of Destiny and Thud, supported by cards like Summoner's Pact and Manamorphose to find and cast the necessary pieces. The deck also includes various ways to dig through the deck quickly with Serum Powder and Plunge into Darkness. Additionally, there is protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault to ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

The deck focuses on a combination of efficient removal spells, disruptive creatures like Flickerwisp and Teferi, Time Raveler, and powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Ephemerate and Meticulous Archive to keep the pressure up and outvalue the opponent. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building your own board presence to win the game quickly through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The key strategy is to establish a board presence early on with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional value and pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and consistent damage, maintaining tempo and control throughout the game.
